content.description: Much more crimpy at the beginning than Fun with Flanders. The crux is low, it eases up as you get above the second or third bolt.
content.location: Between the two water streaks (right of The Quickie Mart, left of Fun with Flanders).

content.description: Climb up the slabby face to a small over hang and do a few tenuous moves to gain easier ground to the chains. Most of the climbing is really easy, but I found pulling the small roof to be a little tricky.
content.location: This route is between Duff Man is Thrusting and Butter that Bacon. It must be a new route as it's not in the guidebook and is still a little dirty.

content.description:
A good route with great positioning. The crux sits at about the 3/4 mark, just near the anchors. Still cleaning up at the time of this writing, I predict a potential classic? Cool moves, a majority of good rock, and some of the steep! Give it a whirl, its plenty worth it.

There are large red cobbles named after the miracle plant from the Simpsons....".hmmmmm this tastes like grandmas breath"
content.location: On the steep south face of Simpson rock, this is the right hand line.

content.description: Bouldery start leads to jug hauling for the last few bolts.
content.location: The steepest route on the rock, left of Tomaco.  The grade is listed on a cobble at the start.

content.description: There is a slightly technical start followed by long reaches (if I remember right) goes up pulling bulge before the anchor
content.location: This is the route to the left of the Leftorium

content.description: A steep problem with a bad landing.
content.location: This is the boulder directly behind Stupid Sexy Flanders and Tomaco. It has the steep erosion gully that leads north to those other routes and the Minimum trail. Start in the erosion gully on the west side and top out in Shellbyville

content.description: This follows a black streak that has a reachy sideways move.
content.location: This is the route around the corner from Tomaco (right). You can see the chains from the road. Faces East. A great warmup!

content.description: This route starts on positive holds and winds up pulling a fun bulge just before the chains.
content.protection: Bolts to chains.  The chains look terrible, very small and rusted.  May not be great anchors to TR on.
content.location: The first, right most, route on the vertical west face.  Around the corner to the left from Stupid Sexy Flanders, which is the overhanging arete.

content.description: Located in the middle water streak. A little spicy at the crux, but well protected.
This is a slightly overhanging good warm up for some of the other routes.
content.location: Located on the North East side of Simpson rock this route is often shady. Rap from anchor
The East facing side (road side) has two black streaks, this is the right one.

content.description: Climb the blunt arÃªte between the two black streaks; directly behind the clump of trees that are almost touching the wall. Still dirty and has a band of that crumbly maple choss about half way up.  If you know name or FA, comment below and I'll add it.
content.location: Just left of Butter That Bacon
